Description: Shoulder fragment of large North Ionian black-figured pottery closed vase; yellowish slip; tongue pattern at top of shoulder, every fifth red; black band with added red band lined in white below; below, sphinx to left with red on wing and rump, and lion to right with red on mane, back and rump; blobs as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
225 25 sticker on interior (= reference to Kardara) Ink 'UCL n.32' demonstrates Naukratis as provenance
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.054)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl n 32 (Other Accession Number)
